page.title: 17 RECREATION
page.content: Although people acquire more and more home entertainments, villagers make good use of the recreational facilities out of doors. Children enjoy riding their B.M.X. cycles, skipping, roller skating and playing football and cricket on the Estate Play Area, whilst many adults find pleasure attending to their gardens (judging by the Horticultural Soc's Annual Show). From our survey we found that, outside the community activities and Public Houses, recreational pursuits included:_ snooker, volleyball, bad- minton, fishing, windsurfing and sailing at Grafham Water, swimming (H'don and Bedford), ice skating (P'boro) and theatre visits to Cambridge and Peterborogh. Day trips to the East Coast and Wicksteed Park are popular favourites.
